sections.heading: TL;DR (Too Long; Didn’t Read)
content: <ul class="list-disc list-outside mb-4 space-y-1 pl-5">
• The app uses your location to measure distance and trigger interval notifications while you hike.
• Health data is optional. If you allow it, TrailPacing can read Step Count and Active Energy (kilocalories) to enhance session stats.
• No accounts, no servers, no analytics, no ads. Processing happens on your device.
• We don’t sell or share your data with third parties.
• You can change permissions at any time in iOS Settings (Location/Notifications/Health)
• Deleting the app removes the app’s data stored on your device.

sections.heading: Introduction
content: This Privacy Policy explains how TrailPacing (“the App”, “we”, “us”) handles your personal data when you use the App. TrailPacing supports outdoor navigation skills by tracking distance and providing interval notifications. We collect and process the minimum data necessary, keep processing on-device, and are transparent about your choices.
If you do not agree with this policy, please do not use the App.

sections.heading: Collection of Personal Data
content: We may process the following data categories:
<ul class="list-disc list-outside mb-4 space-y-1 pl-5">
• Location data (on-device): GPS-derived data used to calculate distance, intervals, pace and elevation-related metrics during an active session.
• Health data (optional, on-device): If you grant permission, we read Step Count and Active Energy (kilocalories) to display “this session” metrics. We do not write Health data.
• Device settings & preferences (on-device): Your chosen interval size, UI preferences (e.g., stat cards), and notification settings. Stored in UserDefaults.
• Notifications: We schedule local notifications on your device to alert you at distance intervals.
We do not collect names, emails, account identifiers, advertising IDs, or other direct identifiers beyond what iOS permission systems require.

sections.heading: Use of Personal Data
content: We use data solely on your device to:
<ul class="list-disc list-outside mb-4 space-y-1 pl-5">
• Provide core features: distance measurement, interval notifications, live stats (speed, average pace, elevation), and optional session effort indicators (steps/active energy).
• Remember your preferences (intervals, stat cards, permission prompts).
Legal basis (EEA/UK users)
<ul class="list-disc list-outside mb-4 space-y-1 pl-5">
• Location and notifications: Necessary to provide the requested features (performance of a contract / legitimate interests).
• Health data: Explicit consent via the Settings app. You can withdraw consent at any time.
Automated decisions: We do not use automated decision-making or profiling in any way that has legal or similarly significant effects on you.

sections.heading: Sharing of Personal Data
content: We do not sell your personal data. We do not share your personal data with advertisers or data brokers. Processing occurs on your device. We do not operate back-end servers for this App.

sections.heading: Third-Party Services
content: <ul class="list-disc list-outside mb-4 space-y-1 pl-5">

• Apple Health (HealthKit): If enabled, the App reads Step Count and Active Energy to display session metrics. Health data is handled in accordance with Apple’s developer terms. We do not use Health data for advertising, we do not share it with third parties, and we do not write Health data.
• Apple frameworks: Core Location, UserNotifications and other iOS components operate on your device under Apple’s platform rules.

• Backups & diagnostics (platform-controlled): If you use iCloud backups or share device analytics with Apple, Apple’s services may process app data under Apple’s policies. We do not receive those diagnostics.

sections.heading: Cookies and Other Technologies
content: TrailPacing is a native iOS application and does not use cookies or web trackers. We use local storage (UserDefaults) only to keep your preferences on-device.

sections.heading: International Data Transfers
content: We do not transmit your personal data to our servers. As processing occurs on your device, there are no intentional international transfers by us. Any transfers performed by Apple services you enable (e.g., iCloud backups) are governed by Apple’s terms.

sections.heading: Data Retention & Storage
content: <ul class="list-disc list-outside mb-4 space-y-1 pl-5">
• On-device only. We store preferences in UserDefaults and process session data in memory during use. We do not maintain remote copies.
• No long-term retention by us. Session metrics are ephemeral unless you save them within the App (if/when such a feature is enabled).
• Deletion. Deleting the App removes the App’s stored data from your device. You can also revoke Health and Location permissions at any time.

sections.heading: Protection of Personal Data
content: We apply reasonable technical and organisational measures appropriate to this App’s minimal, on-device processing, including:
<ul class="list-disc list-outside mb-4 space-y-1 pl-5">
• Processing on-device within the iOS sandbox; no external transmission by us.
• Using iOS permission controls for Location, Notifications and Health data access.
• Data minimisation: we collect only what the feature needs and keep it only as long as necessary.
No method of electronic processing is 100% secure, but we work to reduce risks through minimal collection and on-device processing.

sections.heading: Your Privacy Rights & Choices
content: Your legal rights (EEA/UK and similar jurisdictions)

Subject to local law, you may have rights to access, rectify, erase, restrict or object to processing, and portability. Because we do not operate a server or maintain user accounts, these rights generally relate to data stored on your device. Contact us if you need assistance exercising your rights.
Your choices in iOS and the App
<ul class="list-disc list-outside mb-4 space-y-1 pl-5">
• Health data (Steps/Active Energy): Enable or revoke at any time via Settings → Privacy & Security → Health → TrailPacing.
• Location: Change at any time in Settings → Privacy & Security → Location Services → TrailPacing.
• Notifications: Manage in Settings → Notifications → TrailPacing.
• In-app preferences: Adjust interval size and stat cards in the App’s settings.
Withdrawing a permission may limit related features.

sections.heading: Children & Privacy
content: The App is not directed to children and is intended for general audiences. We do not knowingly collect personal data from children. If you believe a child has provided Health permissions or used the App inappropriately, please revoke permissions and delete the App, and contact us so we can assist.

sections.heading: Changes to This Policy
content: We may update this policy from time to time. Changes will be reflected by the “Last updated” date at the top.
